commit_message:
Allow to set min,max API microversion in tempest

This patch introduce new devstack variables to set min and max Ironic
API version to allow skip tempest tests.

 TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MIN_MICROVERSION
 TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION

Set TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION to 1.16 as it is latest API
version for mitaka release.

Conflicts:
      devstack/lib/ironic
      doc/source/dev/releasing.rst

Related-Bug: #1655888
Change-Id: Id6d36280f622549a2877aab99c11e4008af67fe7
(cherry picked from commit 76b91709ae24490721f0d60f19eea5ea5ec71434)

commit_message:
Allow to set min,max API microversion in tempest

This patch introduce new devstack variables to set min and max Ironic
API version to allow skip tempest tests.

 TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MIN_MICROVERSION
 TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION

Set TEMPEST_BAREMETAL_MAX_MICROVERSION to 1.22 as it is latest API version for
newton release.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/dev/releasing.rst

Related-Bug: #1655888
Change-Id: Id6d36280f622549a2877aab99c11e4008af67fe7
(cherry picked from commit 76b91709ae24490721f0d60f19eea5ea5ec71434)

subject: Modify default NTP server for Undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 20:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['roles/baremetal-undercloud/packages/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Modify default NTP server for Undercloud

This change modifies the default NTP server for the Undercloud to a
publicly reachable hostname. The pool.ntp.org domain name will resolve
to a list of publicly available NTP servers.

Change-Id: I86143837d4fdd9a0cfea02a12e2eac74746d9eff
'}]
commit_message:
Modify default NTP server for Undercloud

This change modifies the default NTP server for the Undercloud to a
publicly reachable hostname. The pool.ntp.org domain name will resolve
to a list of publicly available NTP servers.

Change-Id: I86143837d4fdd9a0cfea02a12e2eac74746d9eff

developers usage and don't fit CI environment.
Some of them are commented or removed.

commit_message:
Update puppet-openstacklib reference

In order to use os_transport_url function we need
to update ref for puppet-openstacklib to the latest one.
In future this allows us to use transport_url instead of
deprecated rabbit_* parameters.

Change-Id: Ia639543b56f6e39abf866dfe2a1653a59e1c036f

subject: List introspection statuses support
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-09 14:28:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector_client/v1.py', 'releasenotes/notes/list-introspection-statuses-4ad9e7e56823e754.yaml', 'doc/source/cli.rst', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/functional.py', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/test_v1.py', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/test_shell.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ironic_inspector_client/shell.py'], 'message': 'List introspection statuses support

This patch adds support to list introspection statuses as provided by
the Ironic Inspector service.

The CLI code in shell.py:StatusCommand.take_action was refactored to
be able to be reused in the new CLI class shell.py:StatusListCommand.

Change-Id: I121306c158bf71eaa83973cdbd404876a6f8b479
'}]
commit_message:
List introspection statuses support

This patch adds support to list introspection statuses as provided by
the Ironic Inspector service.

The CLI code in shell.py:StatusCommand.take_action was refactored to
be able to be reused in the new CLI class shell.py:StatusListCommand.

Change-Id: I121306c158bf71eaa83973cdbd404876a6f8b479

subject: Remove insecure flag from the Baremetal Introspection client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 07:53:11.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/actions/openstack/actions.py'], 'message': 'Remove insecure flag from the Baremetal Introspection client

The baremetal inspector client does not take the "insecure" argument. It
was incorrectly added in 600dd4765409068266f2bb2d858e48cf4e0ec245.

This is currently breaking TripleO.

commit_message:
Adjust test suite for new psutil versions

psutil 2.x and above has a lot of API changes as described in:
https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/blob/master/HISTORY.rst

So we should work correctly with both old and new psutil
versions by using a version check and use the correct
method/attributes. This allows to eventually unlift the version
cap that starts to hurt.

Related-Bug: 1645918
Change-Id: I6be775e83876271012f6b7a777ea2b5cc3a008f6

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I3a6f847e4d5ff64e09b664dc58b17db4094c814c
(cherry picked from commit 12a328d74f389c36638179d784260c6b447a36e9)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-13 17:18:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/provision.rb', 'spec/unit/provision_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269
'}]
commit_message:
Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269

commit_message:
Add debian to list of distros

Because "debian" is not part of the default list of distros, only
commands that are specifically aimed at Debian get included in the bash
script files produced for that distro.

To correct that, this patch adds debian to the list of distributions.

Change-Id: Ie6bac35f3a4eb07310ead14a6746f6336720c835

recommended action plan computed by the audit.

commit_message:
Add basic pre/post upgrade sanity checks

We cant run the full pingtest yet, so this adds some basic sanity checks
which ensures some enabled services are working, and that we can create
content that survives the upgrade process.

For now this only handles the keystone service, we create/get a user
before the upgrade, then get/delete it afterwards, which gives reasonable
confidence keystone is running OK.

Change-Id: I67c416d0407b54aab72b0e6a67b49f6b42f29709

subject: Add deployed-server backwards compatible template
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-01-10 18:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['environments/updates/README.md', 'environments/updates/update-from-deployed-server-newton.yaml', 'deployed-server/ctlplane-port.yaml', 'deployed-server/deployed-server.yaml'], 'message': 'Add deployed-server backwards compatible template

In Newton, the ctlplane port on deployed-server was called
<hostname>-ctlplane-port. When this code was refactored in
I29fbc720c3d582cbb94385e65e4b64b101f7eac9, the -port suffix was dropped
in favor of <hostname>-<network> convention, and the port resource was
created directly in deployed-server.yaml instead of in a nested stack.

Both of those changes were backwards incompatible -- making it
impossible to upgrade to the new version of deployed-server.yaml without
the ctlplane port getting deleted/recreated, which causes a change in IP
address. The IP address change causes services to be misconfigured on
upgrade attempts.

Change-Id: I45991b60a151abf3c5e4d05a3aa7246b2d25ac5a
'}]
commit_message:
Add deployed-server backwards compatible template

In Newton, the ctlplane port on deployed-server was called
<hostname>-ctlplane-port. When this code was refactored in
I29fbc720c3d582cbb94385e65e4b64b101f7eac9, the -port suffix was dropped
in favor of <hostname>-<network> convention, and the port resource was
created directly in deployed-server.yaml instead of in a nested stack.

Both of those changes were backwards incompatible -- making it
impossible to upgrade to the new version of deployed-server.yaml without
the ctlplane port getting deleted/recreated, which causes a change in IP
address. The IP address change causes services to be misconfigured on
upgrade attempts.

Change-Id: I45991b60a151abf3c5e4d05a3aa7246b2d25ac5a

subject: Continue checking for request url if initially null
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-08 23:41:25.000000000', 'files': ['deployed-server/scripts/get-occ-config.sh'], 'message': "Continue checking for request url if initially null

When using get-occ-config.sh during overcloud upgrades, the script could
potentially be started before the stack has been upgraded. In that
scenario, the script will return null for the request metadata url for
the deployed-server resource since the stack has not yet been updated
and it's still using the previous Heat signaling.

This patch updates the script to just continue checking the resource
metadata if the request url is null. Eventually, once the resource has
been updated, the script will continue and properly populate the
os-collect-config configuration.

Change-Id: I9db54d8ad278715f42b768edf8f0fd21998b2098
"}]
commit_message:
Continue checking for request url if initially null

When using get-occ-config.sh during overcloud upgrades, the script could
potentially be started before the stack has been upgraded. In that
scenario, the script will return null for the request metadata url for
the deployed-server resource since the stack has not yet been updated
and it's still using the previous Heat signaling.

This patch updates the script to just continue checking the resource
metadata if the request url is null. Eventually, once the resource has
been updated, the script will continue and properly populate the
os-collect-config configuration.

Change-Id: I9db54d8ad278715f42b768edf8f0fd21998b2098

The commands specified by UpgradeInitCommand need to be run before
InstanceIdDeployment in deployed-server.yaml, otherwise the upgrades
hang with the resource in progress. This is because the new
python-heat-agent-apply-config has not yet been installed on the
deployed server.

Adding the UpgradeInitCommand (and corresponding
SoftwareConfig/SoftwareDeployment to apply it) will cause the new repos
and python-heat-agent-* rpm's to be installed before
InstanceIdDeployment.

An open question is whether or not Heat should even be triggering the
InstanceIdDepoyment to IN_PROGRESS on upgrade when only the group is
changing from os-apply-config to apply-config. If that turns out to be a
Heat bug, then this patch wouldn't be necessary.

Change-Id: I9d87f995744415b110a7d0bca8d2309d7167148c
"}]
commit_message:
Add UpgradeInitCommand to deployed-server

The commands specified by UpgradeInitCommand need to be run before
InstanceIdDeployment in deployed-server.yaml, otherwise the upgrades
hang with the resource in progress. This is because the new
python-heat-agent-apply-config has not yet been installed on the
deployed server.

Adding the UpgradeInitCommand (and corresponding
SoftwareConfig/SoftwareDeployment to apply it) will cause the new repos
and python-heat-agent-* rpm's to be installed before
InstanceIdDeployment.

An open question is whether or not Heat should even be triggering the
InstanceIdDepoyment to IN_PROGRESS on upgrade when only the group is
changing from os-apply-config to apply-config. If that turns out to be a
Heat bug, then this patch wouldn't be necessary.

Change-Id: I9d87f995744415b110a7d0bca8d2309d7167148c

commit_message:
Improve User Experience by adding an info REST entrypoint

This patch allow the user to query the API in order to:

* Get current collector configuration (period, services, etc)
* Get collected metadata list for a given service (using currently
  configured collector)

For this, the following work have been made:

* Each transformer can now export available metadata for a given
  resource (using a FakeData object and the strip_resource_data method)
* Each collector can now export information for a given resource
  about metadata (using associated transformer) and unit
* A new REST controller 'info' provides API entrypoints to those
  information:
  * configuration with GET /v1/info/config
  * all active services information with GET /v1/info/services
  * given active service information with GET /v1/info/services/SERVICE

Change-Id: I02b1bc5709371785748661b63c5e6f0705ce891b
Implements: blueprint user-experience-improvement (PARTIAL)

commit_message:
Use project_id instead of tenant_id in objects

Objects must use project_id and not tenant_id. The object framework
ensures that tenant_id is added as an extra field for backward
compatibility.

This patch reverts the workaround implemented in change
I4ec9340094bc51cd8aa6e5112bf8114aa26c2982 and implements a proper fix
by explicitly updating the objects.

Co-Authored-By: Artur Korzeniewski <artur.korzeniewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darek Smigiel <smigiel.dariusz@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1630748

Change-Id: Iab90bcab41655b2e210aea0e7581eb00b94ce5e5

commit_message:
Fix ksa mocking in test_cinderclient_unsupported_v1

This test was previously mocking the keystoneauth1
loading code globally which was getting randomly
trampled by other tests that were mocking the
same thing.

This changes the scope on the mock so it should be
isolated from other tests mocking out the same thing.

Change-Id: Id6c35c583edf0938b5d0178ab2cfb54277f0225f
Closes-Bug: #1654393

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/vzstorage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_vzstorage.py'], 'message': "WIP: Convert volume format name from 'parallels' to 'ploop'

Back in 2007, qemu-img got 'ploop' disk image format support
naming it by some reason 'parallels', while within Parallels
it has always been called 'ploop' (parallels loopback device).
Thus, libvirt vz driver and nova libvirt parallels driver
know this format as 'ploop' and use it to generate
instance libvirt xml, while qemu-img references it as 'parallels'.

Strictly speaking, this is a bug of qemu-img. But we cannot
fix it in Qemu without breaking backward compatibility
of user tools working with ploop disks as 'parallels' disks.

The most preferred way to fix it instead in Cinder
where it wraps around qemu-img, but this approach
has been rejected: I44d5c9c4c50b2728b0f9860998222d7c206d796b

So we let Cinder call ploop disk 'parallels' as Qemu does,
but convert 'parallels' to 'ploop' in those volume backends
which are supported by Virtuozzo, vzstorage being the first of them.

Change-Id: Id3d1f15508cec9b7d843e132a6bae45da12aa511
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Convert volume format name from 'parallels' to 'ploop'

Back in 2007, qemu-img got 'ploop' disk image format support
naming it by some reason 'parallels', while within Parallels
it has always been called 'ploop' (parallels loopback device).
Thus, libvirt vz driver and nova libvirt parallels driver
know this format as 'ploop' and use it to generate
instance libvirt xml, while qemu-img references it as 'parallels'.

Strictly speaking, this is a bug of qemu-img. But we cannot
fix it in Qemu without breaking backward compatibility
of user tools working with ploop disks as 'parallels' disks.

The most preferred way to fix it instead in Cinder
where it wraps around qemu-img, but this approach
has been rejected: I44d5c9c4c50b2728b0f9860998222d7c206d796b

So we let Cinder call ploop disk 'parallels' as Qemu does,
but convert 'parallels' to 'ploop' in those volume backends
which are supported by Virtuozzo, vzstorage being the first of them.

Change-Id: Id3d1f15508cec9b7d843e132a6bae45da12aa511

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-19 09:38:00.000000000', 'files': ['agent.yaml.template', 'tests/test_keystone.py', 'monasca_agent/common/keystone.py', 'monasca_setup/main.py'], 'message': 'Add service_type, endpoint_type & region_name querying Keystone Catalog

Monasca URL is pulled from Keystone Service Catalog when not given
explicitly in agent.yaml, but only the URL with service_type=monitoring
and endpoint_type=publicURL will be retrieved.

These two options together with the region_name have been included in
the agent.yaml template and may be configured by monasca-setup, so that
the KSClient object is initialized with such keywords. This client will

Change-Id: Icfbfa7c46db648e3d3c27f8e5c72d02957c778f1
Closes-Bug: #1625573

commit_message:
Add service_type, endpoint_type & region_name querying Keystone Catalog

Monasca URL is pulled from Keystone Service Catalog when not given
explicitly in agent.yaml, but only the URL with service_type=monitoring
and endpoint_type=publicURL will be retrieved.

These two options together with the region_name have been included in
the agent.yaml template and may be configured by monasca-setup, so that
the KSClient object is initialized with such keywords. This client will
retrieve the URL from Catalog accordingly.

Change-Id: Icfbfa7c46db648e3d3c27f8e5c72d02957c778f1
Closes-Bug: #1625573

commit_message:
Disallow underscores in plan names

Plan names are included in the node hostnames created during
deployment. However underscores are not actually allowed in hostnames,
and having them there can cause issues down the line.

Change-Id: Ie8b9376e53a14b857836d90331ff32e5189d1574
Partial-Bug: #1644587

commit_message:
Expand %(tenant_id)s macro in service URLs

Without this, some actions such as tarball upload for plan creation
fail, forcing the user to manually expand the macros in the config
file.

Change-Id: Ie6dc01496c07c6423dd243c1a13b0c066caa0e3b
Closes-Bug: #1649997

(cherry picked from commit 39603d4a2f145b82fa76ae62439f5c9f57df3991)

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I644d57b938497c374cb6f08a894fe21fab10eb41
(cherry picked from commit 39603d4a2f145b82fa76ae62439f5c9f57df3991)

commit_message:
[ironic] Install open-iscsi package evidently

Make sure open-iscsi package has installed evidently
in order to cover standalone ironic conductor case.
Also ipmitool package has been removed since it's
installed by class of ironic::conductor.

Add a parameter to cluster replace nodes called "destroy_original".
If the value is True, it will destroy the replaced nodes. By default,

This patch focuses on cluster action layer and engine service.

Change-Id: I9c23b8f2977990c28e35232e2c06588c9899aad7

commit_message:
destroy nodes after cluster replace

Add a parameter to cluster replace nodes called "destroy_original".
If the value is True, it will destroy the replaced nodes. By default,
the value is False.

This patch focuses on cluster action layer and engine service.

Change-Id: I9c23b8f2977990c28e35232e2c06588c9899aad7

commit_message:
prepare for "destory" parameter in cluster-replace-nodes

this patch adds parameter to ClusterReplaceNodesRequest obj to support
"destory" in cluster-replace-nodes. The default value is 'False' which
means we do not destory the nodes after replacing.

Change-Id: Ida1aa8b954c4a93538ba36cf8f4de9937345a411

commit_message:
Fix indentation of code in network_metadata.py

The lines that return the facts in network_metadata are over indented
and therefore are skipped in node_network_data is set. This patch
corrects the level of indent so that the module works in the case that
node_network_data is set.

Change-Id: I54e947a19a5ef5fb416fd971052e55c1670f0873
Closes-Bug: #1656334

subject: Fix wrong value of require_confirmation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-12 21:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/notification/test_notifier.py', 'zaqar/notification/notifier.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong value of require_confirmation

Currently, Zaqar's notifier driver will be initialized without
any parameter when creating the subscription controller. As a
result, default value 'False' will be used instead of getting
the correct value from conf. This patch will fix this by getting
the option from conf.

Closes-Bug: #1655812

Change-Id: I31ac8c3d374b3ea38d035f1012571e6c49a18b87
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong value of require_confirmation

Currently, Zaqar's notifier driver will be initialized without
any parameter when creating the subscription controller. As a
result, default value 'False' will be used instead of getting
the correct value from conf. This patch will fix this by getting
the option from conf.

Closes-Bug: #1655812

Change-Id: I31ac8c3d374b3ea38d035f1012571e6c49a18b87

subject: Update floating IP tables instance URL check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 14:20:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/floating_ips/tables.py'], 'message': "Update floating IP tables instance URL check

A port can be given a device owner of 'compute:nova' and associated with
a floating IP; which will fail the current check in the floating IPs
table to attempt to resolve an instance details URL.

This patch updates the condition to actually check for the required variable.

Change-Id: Ic5f78525ba41d47c1a548aeab73933f962343ebd
Closes-bug:  1645683
"}]
commit_message:
Update floating IP tables instance URL check

A port can be given a device owner of 'compute:nova' and associated with
a floating IP; which will fail the current check in the floating IPs
table to attempt to resolve an instance details URL.

This patch updates the condition to actually check for the required variable.

Change-Id: Ic5f78525ba41d47c1a548aeab73933f962343ebd
Closes-bug:  1645683

subject: Provider is being get for each checkpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 03:04:05.000000000', 'files': ['karbor_dashboard/checkpoints/views.py'], 'message': "Provider is being get for each checkpoint

In checkpoints/views.py, IndexView class, get_data() method, we list
the checkpoints for a provider.
After that, we iterate the checkpoints for that provider and get the
provider using karbor client. This is not necessary: all the checkpoints
are from the same provider, and even if they weren't, we could use karbor
client to get each provider only once.

Change-Id: I790116137a321570c6d386e435f24a5efde2e607
Closes-Bug: #1643331
"}]
commit_message:
Provider is being get for each checkpoint

In checkpoints/views.py, IndexView class, get_data() method, we list
the checkpoints for a provider.
After that, we iterate the checkpoints for that provider and get the
provider using karbor client. This is not necessary: all the checkpoints
are from the same provider, and even if they weren't, we could use karbor
client to get each provider only once.

Change-Id: I790116137a321570c6d386e435f24a5efde2e607
Closes-Bug: #1643331

commit_message:
tripleo: do not run tripleo-ci jobs on releasenotes patches

Do not waste TripleO CI and OpenStack Infra resources when patching
release notes. Just run the release note jobs and regular python jobs so
we don't waste resources.

Change-Id: I82702fbc915748e6611c7f915a2744e7bd14326d

subject: Restrict placement job to stable/newton
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-14 00:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Restrict placement job to stable/newton

The gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-placement-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job
is only unique for stable/newton since it runs the placement-api
plus cells v2 plus neutron, which are all defaults in master (ocata)
now. The placement-api and cells v2 bits were optional in Newton
so it only makes sense to run this on stable/newton changes now.

Change-Id: I145ed119a7b2ba8548ebbaa8f851fdeb74687320
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict placement job to stable/newton

The gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-placement-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job
is only unique for stable/newton since it runs the placement-api
plus cells v2 plus neutron, which are all defaults in master (ocata)
now. The placement-api and cells v2 bits were optional in Newton
so it only makes sense to run this on stable/newton changes now.

Change-Id: I145ed119a7b2ba8548ebbaa8f851fdeb74687320

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 11:33:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "[py35] image file should be open in binary mode

This does not make a difference on py27, but in py35, there is a
distinct difference between the default 'r' and 'rb' mode. the
default 'rb' makes sure read()'s return bytes not strings. All other
cases of open seem to use 'rb' but this one code path was left to
the default 'r'. So let's please fix it.

Found during, cinder+rally+py35 testing in:
Id78b136ad15ac77717711ebcbb671c2f1dd3a10c

Change-Id: I0f4c37cc2fa3f4bb4291aa51991d8601f6754390
"}]
commit_message:
[py35] image file should be open in binary mode

This does not make a difference on py27, but in py35, there is a
distinct difference between the default 'r' and 'rb' mode. the
default 'rb' makes sure read()'s return bytes not strings. All other
cases of open seem to use 'rb' but this one code path was left to
the default 'r'. So let's please fix it.

Found during, cinder+rally+py35 testing in:
Id78b136ad15ac77717711ebcbb671c2f1dd3a10c

Change-Id: I0f4c37cc2fa3f4bb4291aa51991d8601f6754390

subject: Fix setting the SOAP headers for remote calls.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-13 11:08:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py', 'oslo_vmware/service.py', 'oslo_vmware/pbm.py'], 'message': "Fix setting the SOAP headers for remote calls.

We use SOAP headers to set 'opID' for all service calls and
'vcSessionCookie' for PBM service calls. Commit 6a6336 introduced
regression in setting the vcSessionCookie. This patch fixes this by
setting all headers in one place.

Change-Id: If9630a14d6275f30275825f1822f2cf9af2959a7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix setting the SOAP headers for remote calls.

We use SOAP headers to set 'opID' for all service calls and
'vcSessionCookie' for PBM service calls. Commit 6a6336 introduced
regression in setting the vcSessionCookie. This patch fixes this by
setting all headers in one place.

Change-Id: If9630a14d6275f30275825f1822f2cf9af2959a7

Periods must be >= 1.

commit_message:
Add validation for period and periods

Period is currently constrained to be non-zero and a
multiple of 60. Validate those limits.

Periods must be >= 1.

Had to change the except clause to print out the
msg from the parser. This gives good messages for
these two cases but so-so for other cases

Add tests to ensure validation works as expected

Change-Id: If473359901621dae7f3e4d3be903f5d5d7e2885a

commit_message:

The current coverage test job doesn't provide any result
to developer, we could enable the coverage report in
console output to let the developers know the current
coverage status when run coverage test job.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 10:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_negative.py'], 'message': "Use invalid id with rand string instead of special char

Many negative tests use invalid id with combination of special char
like '#$%%&^&^'.
It has the hash tag which splits the url to a url + fragment identifier part.
Some WSGI backends (such as uwsgi) might cut this part of the url,
and pass it in a different environment variable.

Change-Id: Id69baf8d364f31e6fa745929fea890652d7ee118
Closes-bug: #1545407
"}]
commit_message:
Use invalid id with rand string instead of special char

Many negative tests use invalid id with combination of special char
like '#$%%&^&^'.
It has the hash tag which splits the url to a url + fragment identifier part.
Some WSGI backends (such as uwsgi) might cut this part of the url,
and pass it in a different environment variable.

Change-Id: Id69baf8d364f31e6fa745929fea890652d7ee118
Closes-bug: #1545407

subject: Remove the Container class
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-12 06:00:19.000000000', 'files': ['zun/api/controllers/v1/views/__init__.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/views/containers_view.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "Remove the Container class

Earlier Container class was used to validate the request body
for the container operations. After moving the validation to
JSON schema validator, it has no major use case. So this patch
removes the Container class and moves the logic to represent
containers in to 'views' folder.

Partially-Implements: BP api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: Iefeea415f84236f121bc77ba74a11f72035c6be4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the Container class

Earlier Container class was used to validate the request body
for the container operations. After moving the validation to
JSON schema validator, it has no major use case. So this patch
removes the Container class and moves the logic to represent
containers in to 'views' folder.

Partially-Implements: BP api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: Iefeea415f84236f121bc77ba74a11f72035c6be4

subject: Fix HACKING.rst with hacking checks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 02:55:42.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Fix HACKING.rst with hacking checks

The checks in HACKING.rst is with codename "G", it seems copied
from Glance, as we have defined Searchlight specific cheks in
checks.py and start with "SL", we should use them.

This patch fix the HACKING.rst according to hacking/checks.py and correct
its format.

Change-Id: I3b31150e21df8a6eee898037c4fefd44ca76a88f
Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HACKING.rst with hacking checks

The checks in HACKING.rst is with codename "G", it seems copied
from Glance, as we have defined Searchlight specific cheks in
checks.py and start with "SL", we should use them.

This patch fix the HACKING.rst according to hacking/checks.py and correct
its format.

Change-Id: I3b31150e21df8a6eee898037c4fefd44ca76a88f
Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Protect against non-determinstic sort"

This reverts commit 175bfe048283ae930b60b1cea87874d1fa1d10d6.

The change causes the following error if you're
unlucky enough to have such a marker column.

   ArgumentError: Only '=', '!=', 'is_()', 'isnot()' operators can be used with None/True/False

I saw test_floatingip_list_with_pagination failing,
where fixed_port_id of the marker was None.

Closes-Bug: #1656262
Change-Id: I6c32949d789f25d877d329ef0ae9d8650cb81acf

subject: Use Token Clients from the client factory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 17716, 'name': 'Luz Cazares', 'email': 'luz.cazares@intel.com', 'username': 'luzcazares'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-13 15:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/identity/v2/token_client.py', 'tempest/clients.py', 'tempest/lib/services/clients.py', 'tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/token_client.py'], 'message': "Use Token Clients from the client factory

Token clients were still instantiated separately in clients.py.
For consistency we should use the token clients from the client
factory in service_clients.

Since token clients have a very different interface, they will
ignore most of the parameters passed to them, and they need
an auth_url to be specified, as they don't use an auth_provider
like all other clients. When token clients call __init__ on
super(), they force service, region and auth_provider to None, so
we must ensure that they are not in the kwargs passed through
to super as well.

Documenting this in the ServiceClients class docstring as well
so that consumers know how instantiate a token client from it
in case they need to.

Change-Id: I95a3fd1a8859e807e04717eae82bf01f0d9a2085
"}]
commit_message:
Use Token Clients from the client factory

Token clients were still instantiated separately in clients.py.
For consistency we should use the token clients from the client
factory in service_clients.

Since token clients have a very different interface, they will
ignore most of the parameters passed to them, and they need
an auth_url to be specified, as they don't use an auth_provider
like all other clients. When token clients call __init__ on
super(), they force service, region and auth_provider to None, so
we must ensure that they are not in the kwargs passed through
to super as well.

Documenting this in the ServiceClients class docstring as well
so that consumers know how instantiate a token client from it
in case they need to.

Change-Id: I95a3fd1a8859e807e04717eae82bf01f0d9a2085

blazar-nova is now using a modern hacking we can remove H803 from the

commit_message:
Add util function to build dict from key value pairs

The v1/v3 shell both have the method '_extract_metadata'
which will build dictionary from 'metadata' attribute , but
the logic can be applied any place where 'key=value' pair
is required.

This patch intends to move the function to util file.

Change-Id: I09790fc7844b6c0cc3e2d36462a05b853594d434

commit_message:
More detail description on ATC status

- It is important to also mention TC election.
- "more than" 300 words for translation and review metrics
  has been considered for ATC list.
- Publicizes ATC statistics.
  Since actual statistics data is added periodically with
  releases, it is better to have a link to Wiki.

Change-Id: Ifc663323f258d15ff566bc902bfdcd3ed71d4fed

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-11 07:52:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: change the value of 'had_journaling'.

If rbd replication is enabled, creating a volume will
be divided into two stages:
1) create a volume by calling librbd API.
2) enable rbd mirror for the volume.
In the second stage, if a volume created has no feature
of 'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will be
None. However, after executing 'image.update_features',
'journaling' feature has already added to the volume,
so, the value of 'had_journaling' should not be None
anymore, but no code changes it.

Change-Id: Ie281b842e6d7fadb541fd882ff38b34ca68663d2
Closes-Bug: #1654126
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: change the value of 'had_journaling'.

If rbd replication is enabled, creating a volume will
be divided into two stages:
1) create a volume by calling librbd API.
2) enable rbd mirror for the volume.
In the second stage, if a volume created has no feature
of 'journaling', the value of 'had_journaling' will be
None. However, after executing 'image.update_features',
'journaling' feature has already added to the volume,
so, the value of 'had_journaling' should not be None
anymore, but no code changes it.

Change-Id: Ie281b842e6d7fadb541fd882ff38b34ca68663d2
Closes-Bug: #1654126

commit_message:
Optimize: use 'policy_checker' in wsgi layer to clean code

Cinder's API resource controllers now have their respective
'check_policy' method, it's better to replace them with
existing code in wsgi layer to reduce replication.

Change-Id: I0cd2187297fa29cccdcbf4318de8cc03ffc8f331

commit_message:

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ie2e58ecc331928e198e8210edd710a33b3886260
Closes-Bug: #1082248

The host_passes() method in blazar_filter depends on an old
filter_properties dictionary. However, Nova replaced it by a new
RequestSpec NovaObject. Therefore, the filter is throwing this error:

    "TypeError: 'RequestSpec' object has no attribute '__getitem__'."

This commit changes host_passes() to use the new RequestSpec NovaObject.

Change-Id: I0e57f4ee4655a8658419bfaaffad524369ee10b9
Closes-Bug: #1642137

commit_message:
Replace old filter_properties with new RequestSpec NovaObject

The host_passes() method in blazar_filter depends on an old
filter_properties dictionary. However, Nova replaced it by a new
RequestSpec NovaObject. Therefore, the filter is throwing this error:

    "TypeError: 'RequestSpec' object has no attribute '__getitem__'."

This commit changes host_passes() to use the new RequestSpec NovaObject.

Change-Id: I0e57f4ee4655a8658419bfaaffad524369ee10b9
Closes-Bug: #1642137

subject: Raise exception when find more than one matched Cinder volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-28 06:41:34.000000000', 'files': ['fuxi/volumeprovider/cinder.py', 'fuxi/tests/unit/volumeprovider/test_cinder.py'], 'message': "Raise exception when find more than one matched Cinder volumes

For method fuxi.volumeprovider.cinder.Cinder._get_docker_volume,
It just return the first Cinder volume if find with search_opts,
or None if not find.
But for Fuxi only one volume could exist on backend with the same
name and metadata which contains key 'volume_from', so when find
more than one matched Cinder volume, this method should raise an
exception.

Change-Id: I6b4af9151363a3b6de8294b836f0a46e64566245
Closes-Bug: #1631925
"}]
commit_message:
Raise exception when find more than one matched Cinder volumes

For method fuxi.volumeprovider.cinder.Cinder._get_docker_volume,
It just return the first Cinder volume if find with search_opts,
or None if not find.
But for Fuxi only one volume could exist on backend with the same
name and metadata which contains key 'volume_from', so when find
more than one matched Cinder volume, this method should raise an
exception.

Change-Id: I6b4af9151363a3b6de8294b836f0a46e64566245
Closes-Bug: #1631925

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-05 19:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs'], 'message': 'Workaround to build Fedora 23 images

Fedora 23 only supports python 3. The dib scripts are not setup
to use python 3.  This is a temporary work around since only fedora
23 has this problem.  When CentOS catches up and newer versions of
fedora are released, we can deprecate the python2 scripts for python3.

Change-Id: Ibf21e80850d5ac663215d040c12325b5e1a95cb0
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround to build Fedora 23 images

Fedora 23 only supports python 3. The dib scripts are not setup
to use python 3.  This is a temporary work around since only fedora
23 has this problem.  When CentOS catches up and newer versions of
fedora are released, we can deprecate the python2 scripts for python3.

Change-Id: Ibf21e80850d5ac663215d040c12325b5e1a95cb0

commit_message:
Escape quotes in conn_uri declaration

This causes the manager declaration to fail because the quotes
are expected to be escaped in the Manager declaration.  This
addresses the issue.

Change-Id: Ibf59835a34f2e34212a18e2dc705a84a359b6806
Closes-Bug: #1649124

subject: Remove extra backslash on find command The extra backslash will causes a syntax error, and will cause the play to fail to register any world_writable_dirs for the next play to use.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-15 20:00:25.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel7stig/file_perms.yml'], 'message': 'Remove extra backslash on find command
The extra backslash will causes a syntax error, and will cause the
play to fail to register any world_writable_dirs for the next play
to use.

Change-Id: Ib72342b3cf45441d1e2c2a27b0c68c401149f2ca
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extra backslash on find command
The extra backslash will causes a syntax error, and will cause the
play to fail to register any world_writable_dirs for the next play
to use.

Change-Id: Ib72342b3cf45441d1e2c2a27b0c68c401149f2ca

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-17 09:33:32.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/test_share_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Allow access to all test vm IPs in scenario testing

When the manila service vm is running in the floating network
and doesn't have a direct connection to the tempest test network,
the connections will appear to come from the test VM floating IP.

So instead of allowing only the first interface IP, allow access
from all IPs of the instance and assign the floating ip to the
instance before allowing access for all instance IPs.

Closes-Bug: 1650731
Change-Id: Ifbdfb750cf508754ff9e302b468c816319f9eda4
"}]
commit_message:
Allow access to all test vm IPs in scenario testing

When the manila service vm is running in the floating network
and doesn't have a direct connection to the tempest test network,
the connections will appear to come from the test VM floating IP.

So instead of allowing only the first interface IP, allow access
from all IPs of the instance and assign the floating ip to the
instance before allowing access for all instance IPs.

Closes-Bug: 1650731
Change-Id: Ifbdfb750cf508754ff9e302b468c816319f9eda4

NetApp NFS Cmode: Fix NotFound exception

This should be Cinder's NotFound exception, which is
raised by _get_ip_verify_on_cluster.

Exception.NotFound does not exist.

commit_message:
Checking functionality of DVR

1) Check traffic pass when the SNAT port is enabled
Disable the port and check the traffic is still passing

2) Check centralized routers on DVR setup works through network
node
Update router to be distributed
Check traffic works when the SNAT port is down

3) Fix test_trunk as the function for creating router changed

Change-Id: I5022f42392c0a076aa4980082640392cad1688a0

subject: Fix broken gate of py27 and py35
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-15 12:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dhcp_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix broken gate of py27 and py35

Neutron recent change ffc4489a585294a5a13765ab9520cfe9694f02c2
ensures default sg when create port. Dragonflow will create dhcp
port when create subnet. The tenant from context will be used,
and default sg needs this tenant id.

Change-Id: I36fc909b2189f4bd8eac16f5f5e5aee12e668ef4

Fix the fullstack fail of dhcp app

Ryu recent change a4d4291d100e685e222e379aedeca88fdb54aa73, will use
the length of bin string for serialization. The length will be in a
byte which should not exceed 255. This breaks the dragonflow dhcp app,
as it will pack domain name in a bin string of length 256. So, such
error can be observed:

"ubyte format requires 0 <= number <= 255"

Change-Id: Ibcd20e74b1055c96b983fe17f5403fa904965d1b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken gate of py27 and py35

Neutron recent change ffc4489a585294a5a13765ab9520cfe9694f02c2
ensures default sg when create port. Dragonflow will create dhcp
port when create subnet. The tenant from context will be used,
and default sg needs this tenant id.

Change-Id: I36fc909b2189f4bd8eac16f5f5e5aee12e668ef4

Fix the fullstack fail of dhcp app

Ryu recent change a4d4291d100e685e222e379aedeca88fdb54aa73, will use
the length of bin string for serialization. The length will be in a
byte which should not exceed 255. This breaks the dragonflow dhcp app,
as it will pack domain name in a bin string of length 256. So, such
error can be observed:

"ubyte format requires 0 <= number <= 255"

Change-Id: Ibcd20e74b1055c96b983fe17f5403fa904965d1b

subject: Drop ARA testing for Ansible 2.x, update 2.1.x to 2.1.3.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-14 19:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Drop ARA testing for Ansible 2.x, update 2.1.x to 2.1.3.0

Ansible 2.0.x is more or less officially end-of-life [1], let's
stop testing for it.
2.1.3.0 has since then been released so let's test that for the
2.1.x branch now.

[1]: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/ansible-devel/6-6FdxZ94kc

Change-Id: I1ae8ef72c624e873aaed45d29837e2f7bd657a69
"}]
commit_message:
Drop ARA testing for Ansible 2.x, update 2.1.x to 2.1.3.0

Ansible 2.0.x is more or less officially end-of-life [1], let's
stop testing for it.
2.1.3.0 has since then been released so let's test that for the
2.1.x branch now.

[1]: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/ansible-devel/6-6FdxZ94kc

commit_message:
Add CG capability to generic groups in VNX driver

This patch adds the consistency group capability to generic group in
VNX driver. Consistency groups will be used as generic groups.

DocImpact:
Implements: blueprint vnx-generic-group
Change-Id: I92ad0032e5b4e0f72157febe64205a4d72a561e5

commit_message:
Fix broken gate of py27 and py35

Neutron recent change ffc4489a585294a5a13765ab9520cfe9694f02c2
ensures default sg when create port. Dragonflow will create dhcp
port when create subnet. The tenant from context will be used,
and default sg needs this tenant id.

Change-Id: I36fc909b2189f4bd8eac16f5f5e5aee12e668ef4

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 11:50:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_volumeops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Set backend UUID to volume UUID

Currently we do not set the UUID of volume backing in vCenter
to volume UUID. We identify the volume in the backend by its
name. Querying the volume by name in vCenter is slow for large
deployments. This patch sets the UUID of the volume backing in
vCenter to Cinder volume UUID so that we can use vCenter
SearchIndex API to query the volume by UUID which is much
faster than query by name.

Partial-bug: #1600754
Change-Id: Ie14ae1c3d49f7fc9d3ee9dc8173b305dff57a105
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Set backend UUID to volume UUID

Currently we do not set the UUID of volume backing in vCenter
to volume UUID. We identify the volume in the backend by its
name. Querying the volume by name in vCenter is slow for large
deployments. This patch sets the UUID of the volume backing in
vCenter to Cinder volume UUID so that we can use vCenter
SearchIndex API to query the volume by UUID which is much
faster than query by name.

Partial-bug: #1600754
Change-Id: Ie14ae1c3d49f7fc9d3ee9dc8173b305dff57a105

subject: Run functional tests with SDK 0.9.12
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2017-01-15 07:58:46.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Run functional tests with SDK 0.9.12

- Reverts commit 89b7488d2f96ff179bba4b95a0c63dda3ed1b249. (which
blacklisted SDK 0.9.12 from our local requirements.

- Unskip all skipped tests.

- Depend on a global-requirements change that caps projects to
  SDK 0.9.10

We'll need to make sure this passes otherwise we'll continuously
get broken on every new SDK release.

Depends-On: Ib2bb2368459d6f940be59f49fb76bf147c445610
Change-Id: I462596a9af8275deb60a0c5e0f2d2c9acf593ff6
"}]
commit_message:
Run functional tests with SDK 0.9.12

- Reverts commit 89b7488d2f96ff179bba4b95a0c63dda3ed1b249. (which
blacklisted SDK 0.9.12 from our local requirements.

- Unskip all skipped tests.

- Depend on a global-requirements change that caps projects to
  SDK 0.9.10

We'll need to make sure this passes otherwise we'll continuously
get broken on every new SDK release.

Depends-On: Ib2bb2368459d6f940be59f49fb76bf147c445610
Change-Id: I462596a9af8275deb60a0c5e0f2d2c9acf593ff6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-11 14:47:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_snat_ns.py'], 'message': "Unplug external device when delete snat namespace

[1] allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and delete the
namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts. But Method
SnatNamespace.delete unplugs 'sg-XXX' devices only, leads to stale
port remaining in ovs bridge.

This patch identify the stale external device and unplug it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326729/

Change-Id: I27fff32aeeecdc599a578637f390dc1d73f0171b
Closes-Bug: #1649092
"}]
commit_message:
Unplug external device when delete snat namespace

[1] allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and delete the
namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts. But Method
SnatNamespace.delete unplugs 'sg-XXX' devices only, leads to stale
port remaining in ovs bridge.

This patch identify the stale external device and unplug it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326729/

Change-Id: I27fff32aeeecdc599a578637f390dc1d73f0171b
Closes-Bug: #1649092

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-01-05 10:27:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py'], 'message': "Port libvirt.test_vif to Python 3

We can't compare int or None with str on Python 3, need convert str
into int or just skip. We do this comprehensively for vlan by ensuring
that it is initially parsed as an int.

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I000839a341aa6164343b6c44e29a8b7d79084b73
"}]
commit_message:
Port libvirt.test_vif to Python 3

We can't compare int or None with str on Python 3, need convert str
into int or just skip. We do this comprehensively for vlan by ensuring
that it is initially parsed as an int.

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I000839a341aa6164343b6c44e29a8b7d79084b73

commit_message:
Fix quota show --default command

Work around a bug in OpenStack SDK 0.9.11 and 0.9.12 that causes
quota show --default to fail.  This can be removed when the proposed
SDK fix (https://review.openstack.org/420301) is reelased and in the
minimum SDK version in global requirements.

quota set --network is still broken, I can't fix it at the moment...

Closes-bug: 1656572
Change-Id: Ice77e14782c33e672176afbab36bba95b73d7a11

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 14:55:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Delete volume when rescheduling

If a reschedulable failure happens in the driver after the volume was
created on the backend, it will get orphaned and only way to remove it
will be through backend internals. This commit adds an additional
delete_volume call to the driver after the volume got rescheduled to
make sure no volumes will get orphaned.

Change-Id: Idd86a4842bdc6ecf0cabbeff0a9c9704e030302a
Closes-Bug: 1561579
'}]
commit_message:
Delete volume when rescheduling

If a reschedulable failure happens in the driver after the volume was
created on the backend, it will get orphaned and only way to remove it
will be through backend internals. This commit adds an additional
delete_volume call to the driver after the volume got rescheduled to
make sure no volumes will get orphaned.

Change-Id: Idd86a4842bdc6ecf0cabbeff0a9c9704e030302a
Closes-Bug: 1561579

to improve nova cell deployment.
Until it's fixed upstream, we need to disable cells deployment for now,

commit_message:
nova: disable ::nova::db::sync_cell_v2

This feature is broken for us now and there is work in progress in Nova
to improve nova cell deployment.
Until it's fixed upstream, we need to disable cells deployment for now,
so we can promote our CI.

Change-Id: I379ba9e94a92ed225a03a67fc975b542447a9c8b
Related-Bug: #1649341

commit_message:
Keep Ceilometer api enabled for Ocata Undercloud

Due to the deprecation policy and giving our users more
time to switch to gnocchi/aodh/panko, We will continue
running ceilometer API for one more release.

This will be set to false in pike release as per deprecation
policy guidelines. Users are expected to completely switch
to other supported services by then.

This support was added in I9e77ed7d285c69d89aea1f62a098a25619c57420

Change-Id: Ib13b097aa242ad4bf5a0177a28ba4d2dae4dca5f

When retyping a volume we should be updating the replication_status in

commit_message:
Set replication_status automatically on retype

When retyping a volume we should be updating the replication_status in
accordance with the new volume type, but right now we are leaving it to
the drivers to do so, which means that in some cases it is not being
updated.

This patch fixes this by doing it automatically based on the
replication_enabled value in extra_specs.

Closes-Bug: #1643884
Change-Id: I10a7931ed4a73dfd2b69f0db979bc32a71aedb11

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-06 17:15:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix TypeError in _update_from_compute_node race

A compute node record is created in the database from the
_init_compute_node method in the resource tracker in the
nova-compute service. It is created without the updated_at
or free_disk_gb fields being set.

Shortly after it's created, update_resource_stats() is called
on the scheduler report client which calls compute_node.save()
which calls the update_compute_node() method in the DB API which
*always* updates the updated_at field even if nothing else
was changed.

So at this point, we have a compute node with updated_at set
but not free_disk_gb. The free_disk_gb field gets set by the
_update_usage_from_instances() method in the resource tracker
and then that value is later saved off when the compute node
is updated in the database on a second call to the
update_resource_stats() method in the scheduler report client.
At that point the free_disk_gb field is set on the compute
node record.

There is a race in between the compute node create and initial
update but before free_disk_gb is set where the scheduler host
manager can be attempting to update the HostState object from
the same compute node when selecting host destinations during
a server build. If that picks up the compute node before its
free_disk_gb field is set it will result in a TypeError when
trying to multiply None * 1024.

Change 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2 was an earlier
attempt at fixing this bug and shortened the race window but
didn't handle the problem where updated_at is set but free_disk_gb
is not yet.

This change builds on that by simply checking for the thing
the scheduler host manager actually cares about, which is the
free_disk_gb field.

Closes-Bug: #1654102
Closes-Bug: #1610679

Change-Id: I37b75dabb3ea7ec2d5678550d9aff30b1a0c29e6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in _update_from_compute_node race

A compute node record is created in the database from the
_init_compute_node method in the resource tracker in the
nova-compute service. It is created without the updated_at
or free_disk_gb fields being set.

Shortly after it's created, update_resource_stats() is called
on the scheduler report client which calls compute_node.save()
which calls the update_compute_node() method in the DB API which
*always* updates the updated_at field even if nothing else
was changed.

So at this point, we have a compute node with updated_at set
but not free_disk_gb. The free_disk_gb field gets set by the
_update_usage_from_instances() method in the resource tracker
and then that value is later saved off when the compute node
is updated in the database on a second call to the
update_resource_stats() method in the scheduler report client.
At that point the free_disk_gb field is set on the compute
node record.

There is a race in between the compute node create and initial
update but before free_disk_gb is set where the scheduler host
manager can be attempting to update the HostState object from
the same compute node when selecting host destinations during
a server build. If that picks up the compute node before its
free_disk_gb field is set it will result in a TypeError when
trying to multiply None * 1024.

Change 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2 was an earlier
attempt at fixing this bug and shortened the race window but
didn't handle the problem where updated_at is set but free_disk_gb
is not yet.

This change builds on that by simply checking for the thing
the scheduler host manager actually cares about, which is the
free_disk_gb field.

Closes-Bug: #1654102
Closes-Bug: #1610679

Change-Id: I37b75dabb3ea7ec2d5678550d9aff30b1a0c29e6

subject: Clean up developer mode logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-14 05:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/cinder_install.yml'], 'message': 'Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: Id9571a51b3b3e0403eb51a01994a88f387ebfa9e
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: Id9571a51b3b3e0403eb51a01994a88f387ebfa9e

subject: Use git+file urls instead of directories
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-14 20:40:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/functional/post_test_hook_tips.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Use git+file urls instead of directories

The /opt/stack/new directories are owned by the wrong user, so python
setup.py egg_info fails because it can't create the egg_info dir.
Changing the invocation to use git+file:// urls solves the problem.

Additionally, make a correction to test collection.

Change-Id: I39da0b26417dce1a72b15dedc02d10284329307f
"}]
commit_message:
Use git+file urls instead of directories

The /opt/stack/new directories are owned by the wrong user, so python
setup.py egg_info fails because it can't create the egg_info dir.
Changing the invocation to use git+file:// urls solves the problem.

Additionally, make a correction to test collection.

Change-Id: I39da0b26417dce1a72b15dedc02d10284329307f

commit_message:
Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: I6b0c6b4708b449e1961fce0e2b98389813844fc9

commit_message:
Python3 common patterns

Modify some codes in order to lead them meet the python3 common pattern:
          filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data)

Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns

Change-Id: I0b876e446ea1886cdd93c9489e64e5fab0c709d8

commit_message:
Fix network functional tests for sdk 0.9.12

it seems the SDK returns "is_default", but doesn't actually set
it based on --default or --is-default

I already had these functioanl tests mostly converted to JSON, so I dumped
that in here too to make the is_default stuff cleaner.

Change-Id: I47ca62f57c73aa7fa984ca54742fc86b6bb837c4

can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: I4f0ad47547ef9c85dda33ec93de186125323bc9f

commit_message:
Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: I4f0ad47547ef9c85dda33ec93de186125323bc9f

commit_message:
Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: Id41f3963f4be4444dca8362e6f71f537f01429f2

commit_message:
Fix floating IP delete and show by IP

The floating IP delete and show commands did not work using IP addresses
as the selector, only ID.  The SDK floating_ip resource does not support
but OSC does, so we have to do it ourselves.

Now with more SDK 0.9.10 support!

Change-Id: Iea1b57cded6b16a56a06af87ab8f1fa001a3485e
Closes-bug: 1656402

commit_message:
Fix subnet creating failure in functional test

Noticed sometimes floating ip func test failed[1].

The first mumber of the address seems like cannot
bigger than 223. So specify subnet ranges as the
random number between 0 to 233, maybe it will safer
for our functional tests.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/50/418650/12/check/gate-osc-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/e163f68/console.html#_2017-01-14_06_58_35_930306

Change-Id: I44a23bce851dcf2009c8d77059cf75ed80145fb0

commit_message:
Introduce `exit` phase

For the upcoming and new block device handling there needs to be a way
of freeing resources that were allocated in an earlier phase.

This patch introduces the new phase and a adapts the documentation.

Change-Id: I0af65298bae6cc9a4e6f5a664e3ffc054cc28e87
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

query timeout.

subject: Fix bad request error for valid marker in hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 06:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Fix bad request error for valid marker in hosts

Even if we pass a valid host id as marker to the curl command
to return list of hosts, it returns a Bad Request error.
This is due to the use of 'FailoverSegment' instead of 'Host'
while generating the query.

This patch fixes the issue by replacing 'FailoverSegment' with
'Host'.

Updated test cases for failover segments and notifications along
with hosts for testing scenario with valid limit and marker.

Change-Id: I3c64d32f93a2bc09f1754b0fbb93d53c375899a2
Closes-bug: #1654154
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bad request error for valid marker in hosts

Even if we pass a valid host id as marker to the curl command
to return list of hosts, it returns a Bad Request error.
This is due to the use of 'FailoverSegment' instead of 'Host'
while generating the query.

This patch fixes the issue by replacing 'FailoverSegment' with
'Host'.

Updated test cases for failover segments and notifications along
with hosts for testing scenario with valid limit and marker.

Change-Id: I3c64d32f93a2bc09f1754b0fbb93d53c375899a2
Closes-bug: #1654154

subject: Remove deps under pep8 section to enable hacking checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 08:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove deps under pep8 section to enable hacking checks

Hacking checks are not working due to the presence of
"deps = hacking" under pep8 section. This installs the
latest version of hacking library which is 0.13.0 and
it has some issues due to which custom hacking checks
are not working.

After removing it from pep8 section, the hacking
version to be used is referred from test-requirements.txt
and it installs hacking library version 0.10.2 which does
not have this issue.

Change-Id: I6ef802838c05f93b15a3a5a0359b6ea3579fa476
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deps under pep8 section to enable hacking checks

Hacking checks are not working due to the presence of
"deps = hacking" under pep8 section. This installs the
latest version of hacking library which is 0.13.0 and
it has some issues due to which custom hacking checks
are not working.

After removing it from pep8 section, the hacking
version to be used is referred from test-requirements.txt
and it installs hacking library version 0.10.2 which does
not have this issue.

Change-Id: I6ef802838c05f93b15a3a5a0359b6ea3579fa476

subject: Ensure 0755 default mode on new directories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 21:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/magnum_pre_install.yml', 'tasks/magnum_install.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure 0755 default mode on new directories

This patch ensures that all directories under `/openstack/venvs`
are created with `0755` permissions by default. This prevents
permission denied errors when running certain commands from the
virtual environment.

Change-Id: I3d55c3d605b4c7ed11eb7d12f41b94b384e74363
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure 0755 default mode on new directories

This patch ensures that all directories under `/openstack/venvs`
are created with `0755` permissions by default. This prevents
permission denied errors when running certain commands from the
virtual environment.

Change-Id: I3d55c3d605b4c7ed11eb7d12f41b94b384e74363

subject: Make umask change opt-in
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-13 13:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-020230.rst', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Make umask change opt-in

Changing the default umask causes issues with OpenStack-Ansible
deployments in roles where directories are created without a mode
specified. It also may surprise some users on non-OpenStack systems
who expect the default umask to match the default from the OS.

This patch makes the change an opt-in change and it updates the
documentation to reflect that.

Related-bug: 1656003
Change-Id: I0931a34b1114e3a57e0eb5914124eed589ded541
'}]
commit_message:
Make umask change opt-in

Changing the default umask causes issues with OpenStack-Ansible
deployments in roles where directories are created without a mode
specified. It also may surprise some users on non-OpenStack systems
who expect the default umask to match the default from the OS.

This patch makes the change an opt-in change and it updates the
documentation to reflect that.

Related-bug: 1656003
Change-Id: I0931a34b1114e3a57e0eb5914124eed589ded541

Currently placement API been configured with
default port as 8778 which seems used by senlin.

Now senlin services cannot be started on same port
and gate failing[1].

Each service supposed to maintain their default port
here[2] but not much entry there.

There is ML also about this[3], Let's change the placement
API default port to 8780 to unblock senlin gate.
Hope this port is not being used by other services.

..[1] http://logs.openstack.org/58/412658/2/check/gate-senlin-dsvm-tempest-api/03d369c/logs/screen-sl-api.txt.gz#_2016-12-20_03_56_25_698
..[2] http://docs.openstack.org/newton/config-reference/firewalls-default-ports.html
..[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/109219.html

Change-Id: Ib3f7e9475d5d70fe4d97aa7165e42afe6419d926
"}]
commit_message:
Change placement API default port to 8780

Currently placement API been configured with
default port as 8778 which seems used by senlin.

Now senlin services cannot be started on same port
and gate failing[1].

Each service supposed to maintain their default port
here[2] but not much entry there.

There is ML also about this[3], Let's change the placement
API default port to 8780 to unblock senlin gate.
Hope this port is not being used by other services.

..[1] http://logs.openstack.org/58/412658/2/check/gate-senlin-dsvm-tempest-api/03d369c/logs/screen-sl-api.txt.gz#_2016-12-20_03_56_25_698
..[2] http://docs.openstack.org/newton/config-reference/firewalls-default-ports.html
..[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/109219.html

Change-Id: Ib3f7e9475d5d70fe4d97aa7165e42afe6419d926

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/0c30147f2cdf5a9c99dd9469315d9316

Change-Id: I23493f3126982b59a3e19bd3c5f072295cdd6b30

subject: Update the generic resource pools spec to reflect reality
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-09 14:23:59.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.rst'], 'message': 'Update the generic resource pools spec to reflect reality

During the development of the placement API, some details ended
up being different than what was originally specified. The changes
herein attempt to make the spec reflect reality.

The changes include

* don't use $ when assigning shell variables in examples
* add GET allocations by consumer
* add GET allocations by resource provider
* fix URIs in link examples of resoure providers (they were shown as
  relative links)
* correct "type": "uuid" jsonschema to use "type": "string" with a
  "format" of "uuid".
* other minor jsonschema corrections here and there
* Correct inventory create and update response bodies from empty
  responses to having a body

Change-Id: I47595a0a2353fdb58e1f7930a06b18312961433d
'}]
commit_message:
Update the generic resource pools spec to reflect reality

During the development of the placement API, some details ended
up being different than what was originally specified. The changes
herein attempt to make the spec reflect reality.

The changes include

* don't use $ when assigning shell variables in examples
* add GET allocations by consumer
* add GET allocations by resource provider
* fix URIs in link examples of resoure providers (they were shown as
  relative links)
* correct "type": "uuid" jsonschema to use "type": "string" with a
  "format" of "uuid".
* other minor jsonschema corrections here and there
* Correct inventory create and update response bodies from empty
  responses to having a body

Change-Id: I47595a0a2353fdb58e1f7930a06b18312961433d

to develop a container driver for Manila which was later on
abandoned. Despite of that, the code in the manila-image-elements
remained.

This patch set removes LXC/LXD container support in

commit_message:
Removes LXC/LXD support on manila-image-elements

The support for LXC/LXD was added as part of the initial effort
to develop a container driver for Manila which was later on
abandoned. Despite of that, the code in the manila-image-elements
remained.

This patch set removes LXC/LXD container support in
manila-image-elements. Code-path used for generation of Docker images is
preserved.

This will help for the parallel effort of making
manila-image-elements usable by end users.

Change-Id: I99c6a7fbf2b2fb0cebb7b16d94c66f807e7ac7ef
Closes-Bug: #1646615

commit_message:
Simplify calls to mock_object

mock_object method in TestCase class now accepts keyword arguments that
will be properly handled when no new object is provided, so we can now
simplify calls in our tests.

This patch changes calls like
    self.mock_object(os.path, 'exists', mock.Mock(return_value=True))
into
    self.mock_object(os.path, 'exists', return_value=True)

Change-Id: I904ab4956a081c0292e2c982320e5005b055d3d5

commit_message:
Use ZUUL_REFNAME to get branch info during pack registry

1. ZUUL_REFNAME is used in post and release pipeline.
2. change the tarball name to
   <base_distro>-<install_type>-registry-<branch>.tar.gz it is usefull
   in tag pipeline. we will get name like:
   centos-source-registry-4.0.0.tar.gz

Change-Id: I23b16983d02a5758cb251bed8b026ced992559fe

commit_message:
update global requirement for os-vif to new release 1.4.0

This bump to os-vif 1.4.0 is required because this tag adds classes
needed to implement this approved nova blueprint in ocata[1].  It is
also needed to extend ovs vhostuser in nova/neutron to support some
new features.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack/?searchtext=libvirt-os-vif-fastpath-vhostuser

Change-Id: Ia5da5b3ef28d1b23b217adc5196199df47b54ed9
Depends-On: Ibbba63846d654f5f8e530703af0c00f204408d43
Depends-On: I782111ef47d15321804e5b0e1b6f04a0fbfd8dfe

subject: [k8s_coreos] Enable TLS in Etcd cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-26 08:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/configure-etcd.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-network-service-client.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-network-service.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/make-cert.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubeminion.yaml'], 'message': '[k8s_coreos] Enable TLS in Etcd cluster

With this patch following are done:-
- Configure Etcd with TLS support

Configure Following to commuicate with TLS enabled Etcd:-
- Flannel

Etcd also listens at http://127.0.0.1:2379, so on master nodes
etcdctl can communicate without using certificates.

if TLS_DISABLED="True" then TLS is not enabled for etcd.

Change-Id: I7691ca328c4e1bc0738937b62cd813b5ad7df959
Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s_coreos] Enable TLS in Etcd cluster

With this patch following are done:-
- Configure Etcd with TLS support

Configure Following to commuicate with TLS enabled Etcd:-
- Flannel

Etcd also listens at http://127.0.0.1:2379, so on master nodes
etcdctl can communicate without using certificates.

if TLS_DISABLED="True" then TLS is not enabled for etcd.

Change-Id: I7691ca328c4e1bc0738937b62cd813b5ad7df959
Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe
